comments.body: What's going on here? Looks like invalid syntax, but repeated below so probably on purpose.

So the comment on the right contains the type as expected by mypy. The problem is that the value is platform-dependent while the comment is... just a normal static comment. The workaround I employed here is the use the fact that the `reveal` tests actually search for substring matches, _i.e._ it checkes whether `comment is in expected_value`.
Makes sense, thanks for the explanation.
Xref https://github.com/numpy/numpy/issues/17617 as it is very much relevant for this particular issue.

Perhaps worth a comment on the line above,
```suggestion
# note this comment is deliberate truncated as the result varies by platform,
# and mypy uses substring matching
reveal_type(c16 + i)  # E: numpy.complexfloating[numpy.typing._
```

> Perhaps worth a comment on the line above,

Good call, done as of https://github.com/numpy/numpy/pull/17843/commits/b1b047e0b977463ef97e54bf5a9685b39ae3dd93.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +130,134 @@# note this comment is deliberate truncated as the result varies by platform,
# and the numpy `reveal` tests use substring matching
reveal_type(c16 + i)  # E: numpy.complexfloating[numpy.typing._
reveal_type(c16 + AR)  # E: Any
